pathSummary.example: Related: links to Requirement "REQ-1" via 'implements'; linked from Meeting "M3" via 'discussed_in'

until.description: ISO 8601 datetime string for snooze until time

asOf.description: Timestamp for point-in-time query (ISO 8601 format). Only nodes/edges valid at this timestamp are included.

field.description: Which temporal field to use for filtering. Default: valid_from

edgeFilter.description: Filter edges by property values. Only edges satisfying the predicate will be traversed.

edgePhases.description: Define multiple sequential traversal phases with different constraints per phase. When provided, legacy direction/max_depth/relationship_types are ignored.

fieldStrategy.description: Field pruning strategy to control response payload size. compact removes paths/phaseIndex (~25% reduction), minimal keeps only essential fields (~45% reduction).

maxPathsPerNode.description: Maximum paths to track per node (used with returnPaths). Limits memory usage when a node is reachable via many routes.

nodeFilter.description: Filter nodes by property values using JSON Pointer paths and comparison operators. Only nodes satisfying the predicate are included.

returnPaths.description: When true, include full paths from root nodes to each result node. Each path is an array of node IDs showing the traversal route.

temporalFilter.description: Filter nodes and edges based on temporal validity. Enables point-in-time queries to see historical graph state.

totalResults.description: Total number of results across both types

enabled.description: Whether to include relationships for graph results

maxNeighbors.description: Maximum number of neighbors per graph result

fusionStrategy.description: Strategy for combining/fusing graph and text results

includeDebug.description: Whether to include debug metadata in response

limit.description: Maximum total number of results to return

maxTokenBudget.description: Maximum token budget for field truncation (applies to graph results)

relationshipOptions.description: Options for expanding relationships in graph results

weights.description: Weights for combining graph and text scores

debug.description: Debug information (only included with search:debug scope)

enabled.description: Whether embedding is enabled for this object type

excludedLabels.description: Labels that prevent embedding if present on the object

maxPropertySize.description: Maximum property size in bytes. Objects with properties larger than this will not be embedded.

relevantPaths.description: JSON Pointer paths to relevant properties

requiredLabels.description: Labels that must be present on the object for it to be embedded

auto_extract_config.description: Configuration for automatic extraction (enabled_types, min_confidence, duplicate_strategy, require_review, notify_on_complete, notification_channels)

auto_extract_objects.description: Enable/disable automatic extraction of objects from uploaded documents

chat_prompt_template.description: Custom chat prompt template. Supports placeholders: {{SYSTEM_PROMPT}}, {{MCP_CONTEXT}}, {{GRAPH_CONTEXT}}, {{MESSAGE}}, {{MARKDOWN_RULES}}

kb_purpose.description: Markdown description of the knowledge base purpose and domain. Used by auto-discovery to understand context.

avatarObjectKey.description: Object storage key for avatar (if stored internally)

displayName.description: Display name fallback (explicit) or derived (first + last)

phoneE164.description: E.164 formatted phone number, leading + and digits

subjectId.description: Canonical internal user id (subject id, from identity provider) - DEPRECATED: use id

labelsAny.description: Require any label (overlap)  matches rows whose labels array overlaps any listed label

minScore.description: Optional max distance (cosine) filter (0  d  2; typical cosine range).

post.description: Enumerate divergent canonical graph objects between source and target branches. Default is dry-run (no mutations). If `execute=true` and there are no conflicts: Added objects are cloned into target; Fast-forward objects are patched by adding only new properties (superset heuristic). Conflicts block apply. Classification statuses: added, unchanged, fast_forward, conflict.

get.description: Websearch syntax over inline-populated tsvector (type, key, properties JSON). Returns newest heads ranked by ts_rank. Supports optional type, label, branch_id filters. Limit max 100.

Supports pagination via created_at cursor. Optional order param (asc|desc) controls chronological direction (default asc). Desc returns newest first; cursor always set to last item created_at in current page.

post.description:
Performs semantic search over graph objects and optionally retrieves their neighbors.

**Search Strategy:**
- Uses full-text search (FTS) to find primary results matching the query
- Optionally expands each result to include:
  1. Semantically similar objects (via vector embeddings)
  2. Directly connected objects (via relationships)

**Use Cases:**
- Chat context retrieval (similar to document citations)
- Discovery features ("related objects")
- Rich detail views with context

**Neighbor Sources:**
- **Semantic**: Objects with similar embedding vectors (via searchSimilar)
- **Relational**: Objects connected via graph relationships (depends_on, implements, etc.)

**Example:**
```json
{
  "query": "authentication patterns",
  "limit": 5,
  "includeNeighbors": true,
  "maxNeighbors": 3,
  "maxDistance": 0.5
}
```

neighbors.description: Map of object ID to array of neighbor objects

post.summary: Search graph objects with optional neighbor expansion

dryRun.description: Whether this was a dry run

recipients.description: Per-recipient results (only in dry run or on request)

status.description: Status: pending, accepted, declined, revoked, expired

until.description: ISO 8601 datetime string for snooze until time

deliveryStatusAt.description: When the delivery status event occurred

asOf.description: Timestamp for point-in-time query (ISO 8601 format). Only nodes/edges valid at this timestamp are included.

field.description: Which temporal field to use for filtering. Default: valid_from

tools.description: Array of tool definitions with metadata

edgeFilter.description: Filter edges by property values. Only edges satisfying the predicate will be traversed.

edgePhases.description: Define multiple sequential traversal phases with different constraints per phase. When provided, legacy direction/max_depth/relationship_types are ignored.

fieldStrategy.description: Field pruning strategy to control response payload size. compact removes paths/phaseIndex (~25% reduction), minimal keeps only essential fields (~45% reduction).

maxPathsPerNode.description: Maximum paths to track per node (used with returnPaths). Limits memory usage when a node is reachable via many routes.

nodeFilter.description: Filter nodes by property values using JSON Pointer paths and comparison operators. Only nodes satisfying the predicate are included.

returnPaths.description: When true, include full paths from root nodes to each result node. Each path is an array of node IDs showing the traversal route.

temporalFilter.description: Filter nodes and edges based on temporal validity. Enables point-in-time queries to see historical graph state.

objectIds.description: Array of object IDs to generate embeddings for

priority.description: Priority for embedding jobs (higher = processed first)

force.description: Force regeneration even if embedding already exists

objectType.description: Object type filter (if specified, only regenerate embeddings for this type)

priority.description: Priority for embedding jobs (higher = processed first)

projectId.description: Project ID to regenerate embeddings for

force.description: Force re-fetch even if no changes detected

totalResults.description: Total number of results across both types

enabled.description: Whether to include relationships for graph results

maxNeighbors.description: Maximum number of neighbors per graph result

fusionStrategy.description: Strategy for combining/fusing graph and text results

includeDebug.description: Whether to include debug metadata in response

limit.description: Maximum total number of results to return

maxTokenBudget.description: Maximum token budget for field truncation (applies to graph results)

relationshipOptions.description: Options for expanding relationships in graph results

weights.description: Weights for combining graph and text scores

debug.description: Debug information (only included with search:debug scope)

email.description: Email address associated with this token

enabled.description: Whether embedding is enabled for this object type

excludedLabels.description: Labels that prevent embedding if present on the object

maxPropertySize.description: Maximum property size in bytes. Objects with properties larger than this will not be embedded.

relevantPaths.description: JSON Pointer paths to relevant properties

requiredLabels.description: Labels that must be present on the object for it to be embedded

syncIntervalMinutes.description: Sync interval in minutes (for periodic sync policy)

allow_parallel_extraction.description: When true, allows multiple extraction jobs to run in parallel for this project. When false (default), jobs are queued and run one at a time.

auto_extract_config.description: Configuration for automatic extraction (enabled_types, min_confidence, require_review, notify_on_complete, notification_channels)

auto_extract_objects.description: Enable/disable automatic extraction of objects from uploaded documents

chat_prompt_template.description: Custom chat prompt template. Supports placeholders: {{SYSTEM_PROMPT}}, {{MCP_CONTEXT}}, {{GRAPH_CONTEXT}}, {{MESSAGE}}, {{MARKDOWN_RULES}}

chunking_config.description: Default document chunking configuration. Strategy options: character (fixed boundaries), sentence (preserves sentences), paragraph (preserves paragraphs/sections). Chunk sizes should align with LLM extraction batch size (1:4 ratio).

extraction_config.description: LLM extraction configuration. Controls chunk size (5000-100000 chars), extraction method (function_calling or responseSchema), and per-call timeout (60-600 seconds).

kb_purpose.description: Markdown description of the knowledge base purpose and domain. Used by auto-discovery to understand context.
kb_purpose.example: This knowledge base contains documentation about...

hasEmail.description: Whether user has email in local DB

avatarObjectKey.description: Object storage key for avatar (if stored internally)

displayName.description: Display name fallback (explicit) or derived (first + last)

phoneE164.description: E.164 formatted phone number, leading + and digits

subjectId.description: Canonical internal user id (subject id, from identity provider) - DEPRECATED: use id

error.description: Error message if user not found

failed.description: Total failed syncs since worker start

processed.description: Total users processed since worker start

running.description: Whether the worker is currently running

succeeded.description: Total successful syncs since worker start

total.description: Total count of users needing sync

labelsAll.description: Require all labels (array contains)  matches rows whose labels array contains every listed label

labelsAny.description: Require any label (overlap)  matches rows whose labels array overlaps any listed label

maxDistance.description: Alias for minScore (preferred). Same constraints (0  d  2). If both provided, maxDistance wins.

minScore.description: Optional max distance (cosine) filter (0  d  2; typical cosine range).

projectId.description: Filter by project id

If `execute=true` and there are no conflicts: Added objects are cloned into target; Fast-forward objects are patched by adding only new properties (superset heuristic). Conflicts block apply. Classification statuses: added, unchanged, fast_forward, conflict.

post.description:
Performs semantic search over graph objects and optionally retrieves their neighbors.

**Search Strategy:**
- Uses full-text search (FTS) to find primary results matching the query
- Optionally expands each result to include:
  1. Semantically similar objects (via vector embeddings)
  2. Directly connected objects (via relationships)

**Use Cases:**
- Chat context retrieval (similar to document citations)
- Discovery features ("related objects")
- Rich detail views with context

**Neighbor Sources:**
- **Semantic**: Objects with similar embedding vectors (via searchSimilar)
- **Relational**: Objects connected via graph relationships (depends_on, implements, etc.)

**Example:**
```json
{
  "query": "authentication patterns",
  "limit": 5,
  "includeNeighbors": true,
  "maxNeighbors": 3,
  "maxDistance": 0.5
}
```

neighbors.description: Map of object ID to array of neighbor objects

post.summary: Search graph objects with optional neighbor expansion
Traverse the graph from one or more root object ids (bounded BFS)

post.description:
Upload multiple files in a single batch request for efficient document ingestion.
    
**Limits:**
- Maximum 100 files per batch
- Maximum 10MB per file
- Only text-based files are accepted (txt, md, html, json)

**Processing:**
- Files are processed concurrently (3 at a time)
- Each file is checked for duplicates independently
- Binary files are rejected with an error

**Response:**
- Returns a summary with counts and individual results for each file
- Files can have status: 'success', 'duplicate', or 'failed'
- Failed files include an error message explaining the failure

files.description: Array of files to upload (max 100 files, 10MB each)

orgId.description: Optional organisation UUID to associate documents with

projectId.description: Project UUID that all documents belong to (required)

requestBody.description: Upload multiple files for batch ingestion (max 100 files)

200.description: Batch upload completed with summary and individual results

post.description: Receives batched console logs from browser clients for server-side storage. Used for debugging client-side errors.

Model Context Protocol (MCP) server endpoint.

**Protocol:** JSON-RPC 2.0
**Methods:** initialize, tools/list, tools/call
**Tools:** schema_version, schema_changelog, type_info, list_entity_types, query_entities

**Project Context:**
Project-specific tools (list_entity_types, query_entities) require a project ID.
You can provide it either:
1. In the initialize params: `"project_id": "uuid"`
2. Via X-Project-Id header

**Example Initialize Request (with project):**
```json
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 1,
  "method": "initialize",
  "params": {
    "protocolVersion": "2025-06-18",
    "capabilities": {},
    "clientInfo": {
      "name": "example-client",
      "version": "1.0.0"
    },
    "project_id": "1e37ab78-f4af-4e61-9b71-5e263139525b"
  }
}
```

**Example tools/list Request:**
```json
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 2,
  "method": "tools/list"
}
```

**Example tools/call Request:**
```json
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 3,
  "method": "tools/call",
  "params": {
    "name": "schema_version",
    "arguments": {}
  }
}
```
